author: V Geetanath
text:
The countrywide protests over the circumstances leading to the suicide of University of Hyderabad’s research scholar Rohith Vemula should lead to a people’s movement against fascist forces, social inequalities and for dissent within a democratic polity.

This was the overwhelming view expressed by academics drawn from various universities at a national seminar on ‘Social Inequalities: Caste and religious discriminations in universities: in tribute to Rohith Vemula’ organised by the Save Education Committee, Telangana, under the aegis of All India Education Rights Forum, here on Sunday.

The meeting held after a delegation of academics visited the UoH and interacted with officiating Vice-Chancellor Periasamy as well as the protesting students 20 days after the suicide, saw Telangana Joint Action Committee (TJAC) convener Prof. Kodandaram demanding that the UoH and other varsities immediately implement the University Grants Commission (UGC) norms on treating social discrimination on the campuses.
title: Call for people’s movement against fascist forces
